meanings.definition: Subjected to or containing high pressure.
meanings.sent1: The pressurized cabin kept the astronauts safe in space.
meanings.sent2: The pressurized canister held the carbon dioxide gas.
meanings.sent3: The pressurized balloon made a loud pop when it burst.
meanings.sent4: The pressurized water hose sprayed with great force.
meanings.sent5: The pressurized tire exploded with a loud bang.

meanings.sent1: He pressurized the pump to inflate the basketball.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic pressurized the air conditioning system.
meanings.sent3: She pressurized the ketchup bottle to get the last drop out.
meanings.sent4: The chef pressurized the pastry bag to decorate the cake.
meanings.sent5: The hiker pressurized the water filter to purify the stream water.

meanings.definition: To make (someone) feel stressed or anxious.
meanings.sent1: The upcoming exam pressurized the students.
meanings.sent2: The tight deadline pressurized the employees to finish the project.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected guest arrival pressurized the host to prepare quickly.
meanings.sent4: The intense competition pressurized the athletes to perform their best.
meanings.sent5: The financial difficulties pressurized the family to make tough decisions.
